summary: Recent high-profile events have led some to question whether airlines treat all passengers equally, despite federal laws prohibiting discrimination. In 2017, one organization issued a travel advisory (lifted in 2018) against an airline, citing "disrespectful, discriminatory or unsafe conditions" for African-American passengers. Airlines aren’t required to provide non-discrimination training. But, representatives from 6 airlines said they provide it to employees, and 4 said they also...
title: Airline Consumer Protections: Information on Selected Airlines' Non-Discrimination Training Programs
